snippet: A Republican fund-raising advantage among outside groups has led the White House to change course and use surrogates to encourage donations to a “super PAC.”
abstract: Pres Barack Obama signals to wealthy Democratic donors that he wants them to start contributing to an outside group supporting his re-election; move reverses Obama's long-held opposition to the influence of special-interest money; campaign officials say that the decision is necessary in the face of unlimited and unprecedented super PAC spending on behalf of Republican presidential candidates, which has left the Obama camp unilaterally disarmed.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG

lead_paragraph: A Republican fund-raising advantage among outside groups has led the White House to change course and use surrogates to encourage donations to a “super PAC.”

headline.seo: With a Signal to Donors, Obama Yields on ‘Super PACs’
headline.main: Obama Yields in Marshaling of ‘Super PAC’
headline.print_headline: Obama Yields In Marshaling Of ‘Super PAC’
